context: The Estonian verb 'tulema' is the infinitive form of a verb that means 'to come' or 'to arrive'. It belongs to the -ma ending verbs in Estonian. This verb indicates movement toward the speaker or a specified location. In different forms, it can appear as 'tulen' (I come), 'tuled' (you come), 'tuleb' (he/she/it comes), 'tuleme' (we come), and 'tlete' (they come).
